quote: Happiness is a state of activity.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happiness: being able to forget or, to express in a more learned fashion.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  On the Advantage and Disadvantage of History for Life

quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happiness is part of who we are. Joy is the feeling
author: Tony DeLiso,  Legacy: The Power Within

quote: Happiness is the most natural thing in the world when you have it, and the slowest, strangest, most impossible thing when you don't. It's like learning a foreign language: You can think about the words all you want, but you'll never be able to speak it until you suck up your courage and say them out loud.
author: Dan Wells,  Partials

quote: Happiness is a state of mind, a choice, a way of living; it is not something to be achieved, it is something to be experienced.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: Happiness is an accident of nature, a beautiful and flawless aberration.
author: Pat Conroy,  The Lords of Discipline

quote: Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.
author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Starship Troopers

quote: Happiness is not having what you want, it is wanting what you have.
author: Sheryl Crow

quote: Happiness comes when your work and words are of benefit to others.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: To be happy--one must find one's bliss
author: Gloria Vanderbilt

quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.
author: Orhan Pamuk,  Snow

quote: Happiness is the lucky pane of glass you carry in your head. It takes all your cunning just to hang on to it, and once it's smashed you have to move into a different sort of life.
author: Carol Shields,  Unless

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Happiness is what matters, feeling alive-not art or knowledge or money.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: Happiness only real when shared.
author: Christopher McCandless

quote: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
author: William Saroyan,  My Heart's in the Highlands

quote: Happiness earned, not given.
author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting some on yourself.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The secret of happiness is something to do
author: John Burroughs

quote: Happiness is the object and design of our existence; and will be the end thereof, if we pursue the path that leads to it; and this path is virtue, uprightness, faithfulness, holiness, and keeping all the commandments of God.
author: Joseph Smith Jr.

quote: Happiness is the pleasantest of emotions; because of this, it is the most dangerous. Having once felt happiness, one will do anything to maintain it, and losing it, one will grieve.
author: Kij Johnson,  The Fox Woman

quote: Happiness is spiritual, born of truth and love. It is unselfish; therefore it cannot exist alone, but requires all mankind to share it.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The way I define happiness is being the creator of your experience, choosing to take pleasure in what you have, right now, regardless of the circumstances, while being the best you that you can be.
author: Leo Babauta

quote: Happiness. It comes onunexpectedly. And goes beyond, really,any early morning talk about it.
author: Raymond Carver

quote: Happiness is simple. Everything we do to find it is complicated.
author: Karen Maezen Miller,  Hand Wash Cold: Care Instructions for an Ordinary Life

quote: Human happiness is defined by the hardships and conflicts you have been through. The greater they are, the greater is your happiness.
author: Peter Deunov

quote: Happiness is inseparably connected with decent, clean behavior.
author: Boyd K. Packer

quote: The secret of happiness: Find something more important than you are and dedicate your life to it.
author: Daniel C. Dennett

quote: People tend to think that happiness is a stroke of luck, something that will descend like fine weather if you're fortunate. But happiness is the result of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Happiness is an awarenessâ€”a blissful perception, not in ownership or in material possessions.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Happiness is a myth. It was invented to make us buy new things.
author: Gregory David Roberts,  Shantaram

quote: You can't buy happiness
author: Kurt Cobain

quote: Sometimes happiness consists of finding the right balance of misery.
author: Orson Scott Card,  Sarah

quote: Happiness had never been like this before. Now it came like sun showers, the sun and the rain together. Happiness was happier than it had been - sharp, piercing, and snatched, like a breath while swimming in surf.
author: Elizabeth Knox,  Dreamhunter

quote: The secret of happiness is to face the fact that the world is horrible, horrible, horrible.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Happiness is a warm puppy.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: Most people think happiness is about gaining something, but it's not. It's all about getting rid of the darkness you accumulate.
author: Carolyn Crane

quote: Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place, but there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around.
author: E.L. Konigsburg,  From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler

quote: Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance, order, rhythm and harmony.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Happiness is not in things; happiness is in you.
author: Robert Holden,  Happiness Now!: Timeless Wisdom for Feeling Good FAST

quote: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
author: Charles Dickens,  Nicholas Nickleby

quote: Happiness lies for those who cry, those who hurt, those who have searched, and those who have tried for only they can appreciate the importance of people who have touched their lives.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: True happiness is when the love that is within us finds expression in external activities.
author: Mata Amritanandamayi

quote: What good is money if it can't buy happiness?
author: Agatha Christie,  The Man in the Brown Suit
